title: Understanding Acid Dissociation
text: When an acid like HF dissociates in water, it releases a hydrogen ion ($$H^{+}$$) and forms its conjugate base. The conjugate base is what remains of the acid after it donates a proton.

title: Recognize the Conjugate Base
text: In the dissociation reaction of HF, the species that is not the hydrogen ion ($$H^{+}$$) is the conjugate base.

title: Identify the Conjugate Base
text: From the dissociation equation $$HF -> H^{+}+F^{-}$$, identify the conjugate base.
